name: Vegan Gluten-free Lemon Donuts. Grain-free Baked Vegan Doughnuts
description: 1 Bowl Vegan Gluten-free Lemon Donuts Recipe. These baked gluten free doughnuts are amazingly soft. They are grain-free, Easy, Zesty Chickpea flour Donuts. Use lemon or lime. Baked Vegan Doughnuts. Yeast-free Glutenfree Donuts. Makes about 8 to 9
recipeIngredient: 3 tbsp cornstarch or potato starch (or more besan, you might need an additional tbsp of water with besan)
2 tbsp almond flour (or use more besan)
Zest of half (or whole for zestier a lemon, or whole lime)
Juice of a lemon or lime (2 to 2.5 tbsp)
1/3 cup sugar (1 tbsp more for sweeter)
1.5 tsp white or apple cider vinegar
1 to 2 tbsp non dairy milk  (or lemon juice)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc. Grease the doughnut pan really well. Also keep 2 baking sheets (larger than the pan handy).
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F / 200ºc. Grease the doughnut pan really well. Also keep 2 baking sheets (larger than the pan handy).

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, add the flour, starch, almond flour, salt, 1/2 tsp baking powder and zest.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, add the flour, starch, almond flour, salt, 1/2 tsp baking powder and zest.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the wet ingredients and blend until the sugar is combined and the batter is smooth. you want to add not more than total of 2/3 cup liquid(water and lemon juice). You can also mix these in a bowl. The batter should be like a pancake batter on the thin side.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the wet ingredients and blend until the sugar is combined and the batter is smooth. you want to add not more than total of 2/3 cup liquid(water and lemon juice). You can also mix these in a bowl. The batter should be like a pancake batter on the thin side.

recipeInstructions.text: Now, add the remaining baking powder and baking soda and pulse a few times to combine or use a spoon to mix in well. Let the mixture sit for a minute to get slightly frothy. The lemon and baking powder will react to make the batter frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Now, add the remaining baking powder and baking soda and pulse a few times to combine or use a spoon to mix in well. Let the mixture sit for a minute to get slightly frothy. The lemon and baking powder will react to make the batter frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour into prepared donut pan. Fill not more than 2/3 of the height. Place doughnut pan on a baking sheet. Place another baking sheet on top. This will create chamber where some of the steam will stay during baking instead of escaping.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour into prepared donut pan. Fill not more than 2/3 of the height. Place doughnut pan on a baking sheet. Place another baking sheet on top. This will create chamber where some of the steam will stay during baking instead of escaping.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 11 minutes, them remove the top sheet and bake for another 4 to 5 minutes. total 15-16 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 11 minutes, them remove the top sheet and bake for another 4 to 5 minutes. total 15-16 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the pan out and let it sit for a minute, then pat to remove the doughnuts. Let the doughnuts cool completely for 15 minutes. Then frost and let the frosting sit for a few minutes then serve. If not serving immediately, store in airtight container for the day.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the pan out and let it sit for a minute, then pat to remove the doughnuts. Let the doughnuts cool completely for 15 minutes. Then frost and let the frosting sit for a few minutes then serve. If not serving immediately, store in airtight container for the day.

itemListElement.text: Powder the sugar in a blender with 1 tbsp cornstarch. Add to a bowl and add 1 to 2 tbsp non dairy milk or lemon juice and a good pinch of salt. Mix until smooth. Dip donuts in the glaze or drizzle some on the doughnuts. I usually like to drizzle so there is just a bit of glaze and hence less sugar for added moisture.
